document.docAuthor: Kumar, Girish P. & Carpenter, James M.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic review of the genus Antodynerus de Saussure, 1855 (Hymenoptera: Vespidae: Eumeninae) from the Indian subcontinent

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic review of the genus Antodynerus de Saussure, 1855 (Hymenoptera: Vespidae: Eumeninae) from the Indian subcontinent

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ancistrocerus ornatus
Smith 1852 : 49
, ♂, “ Bombay ” (BMNH); junior secondary homonym, nec
Odynerus ornatus (
de Saussure, 1852
)
, replaced by
Odynerus orientalis
Dalla Torre, 1889
.

Odynerus
“
punctum Fabricius
”:
de Saussure, 1853 : 209
, ♀, pl. 19 fig. 2 , “Indes Oientales” (MP) [erroneously regarded as identical to
Polistes punctum
Fabricius, 1804
].

Odynerus orientalis
Dalla Torre 1889 : 125
(replacement name for
Odynerus ornatus (
Smith, 1852
)
, junior secondary homonym of
Odynerus ornatus (
de Saussure, 1852
)
=
Leptochilus ornatus
de Saussure, 1852
);
Dalla Torre 1894 : 83
(cat.);
Dalla Torre 1904 : 51
(cat.). Synonymized with
Odynerus punctum
de Saussure, 1853
by
Dover 1925
.

Lionotus “ punctum de Saussure
”:
Ashmead 1904 a: 8
(cat.; Manila);
Brown 1906 : 688
( Philippines ).

Leionotus
“
punctum de Saussure
”:
Ashmead 1904 b: 133
, 152 (Phillipines).

Odynerus goanus
Sonan 1938 : 261
, ♀, fig. 2, 3 , “ Goa, India ” (ZMB).

Odynerus punctum var. orientalis :
Giordani Soika 1941 : 260
(in subgenus
Rhynchium
; syns.:
Ancistrocerus ornatus Smith
,
Odynerus goanus Sonan
).

Diagnosis. Female . Clypeus with moderately deep punctures on middle, diameter of punctures as wide as distance between punctures; frons sparsely punctured; ocellar area almost smooth without punctures; vertex with moderately strong punctures except at middle and area towards occipital carina; median area of propodeum slightly concave, with a narrowly elongate fovea from which median carina runs to orifice with few weak transverse striations posteriorly; postero-lateral margin almost entirely rounded without a strong transversely carinate projection, area near to valvula with weak transverse striations; T 1 1.64 as wide as long, 0.87 × as wide as T 2 in dorsal view. Male . Clypeus, frons, ocellar area and median area almost smooth; genitalia as in
Fig. 8
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Antodynerus flavescens flavescens (Fabr.)
. 1–5. Female. 1. Body profile; 2. Head front view; 3. Head, dorsal view; 4. Propodeum; 5. Metasoma. 6. Male, head frontal view.

Distribution . India (*Andhra Pradesh, *Assam, Bihar, *Chhattisgarh, *Delhi, Goa, *Gujarat, Karnataka, *Kerala, Maharashtra, *Manipur, Odisha, * Pondicherry , *Tamil Nadu, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal), Bangladesh .
